definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.english: Through his newspaper the liberator he became the voice of abolition .
sentences.chinese: 通过他的报纸，解放者，继任呼声裁撤。

sentences.english: About 100,000 more public sector jobs will be cut.
sentences.chinese: 约跣十万余个公务员职位将被裁撤。

sentences.english: Make " Time-Life News " dissolve 105 high-order executives?
sentences.chinese: 使《时代杂志》裁撤105名高阶主管？

sentences.english: They abolished a department last year.
sentences.chinese: 他们去年裁撤了一个部门。

sentences.english: An irrevocable L/C gives your exports the protection of a banker's guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 不成裁撤的信用证给出口商增添了银行的担保。

sentences.english: One of the measures to reduce the cost of the abolition of the entire group of 50-seat aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 降低成本的措施之一是裁撤整个集团内的50座飞机。

sentences.english: If shipment is too late, we'll be forced to withdraw the contract.
sentences.chinese: 伪设发货太晚的话，我方将被迫裁撤契约。

sentences.english: The buyer has the option of canceling the contract.

definition: to dismiss and replace (sb)/to replace (sb or sth)
to expand (esp. by new recruitment)/to increase the army/to augment
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to transfer/to move to another post
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
